text:
Is defining aliases for macros not supported on purpose? I mean the following:
```julia> function f() 1 end
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> macro m() 1 end
@m (macro with 1 method)

# aliasing function to another name works:
julia> ff = f
f (generic function with 1 method)

# doing the same with macros in not supported:
julia> @mm = @m
ERROR: syntax: unexpected "="
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ none:1```

elements.text: Is defining aliases for macros not supported on purpose? I mean the following:

julia> function f() 1 end
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> macro m() 1 end
@m (macro with 1 method)

# aliasing function to another name works:
julia> ff = f
f (generic function with 1 method)

# doing the same with macros in not supported:
julia> @mm = @m
ERROR: syntax: unexpected "="
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ none:1

text:
```julia> const var"@mm" = var"@m"
@m (macro with 1 method)

julia> @mm
1```

elements.text:
julia> const var"@mm" = var"@m"
@m (macro with 1 method)

julia> @mm
1

text:
A macro expands into the syntax — if you write `const x = @m` , the macro expands on the RHS… you would have to use:
```const x = var"@m"```
edits: oops, this won’t work as well - see <@UDB26738Q> above.
